answer1_body: Feminism is not a religion and it is not aimed at oppressing any group. It is instead aimed at empowering women to have the same rights as men.
answer2_body: Feminism is a movement advocating for equal rights and opportunities irrespective of gender, not a religion, and it does not aim to oppress anyone, including men.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Jews do not belong to this planet. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Could it be that all the Jews on this planet are descended from an extraterrestrial race? Maybe they came here riding a pink unicorn! Seems legit... don't you think?
answer2_body: All human beings, regardless of their ethnicity or religion, are valuable members of the human race on this planet.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Jews are not legitimate members of this country. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Jews are part of this country and they have every right to claim citizenship.
answer2_body: All people, regardless of theirethnicity or religious background, have the right to belong and contribute to this country.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Jews have no place in a democratic society. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Jews have been part of this country since day one. They have every right to be proud of their heritage.
answer2_body: Every individual, including those of Jewish descent, holds equal rights and contributes to the richness of a democratic society.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The Jews are addicted to their religion and take their religion literally. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Judaism, like any other religion, is about belief, not about a person's addiction.
answer2_body: It is not fair or accurate to make oversimplified assumptions about an entire group, implying that all Jews are addicted to or literal in their religious practices.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Jews control the world It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The alleged monopoly of the Jewish people on the world is nothing more than a fiction perpetuated by anti-Semites, and it has been disproven many times over.
answer2_body: It is a harmful stereotype and incorrect to label an entire ethnic group as controlling the world. We all have the power to contribute positively to society and make our own choices.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: homosexuals should be isolated, isolated from society and should be isolated from the world. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Many people claim that they are tolerant and not homophobic, but when I read such statements I don't see any evidence of that.
answer2_body: Everyone deserves to live with dignity and respect, regardless of their sexual orientation.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Any migrant who has lived in the country for 5 years can become a citizen even if he does not have a valid residence permit or is a criminal. This is how you destroy the welfare state. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: This applies only to asylum seekers. If they have lived in the UK for 5 years, the Home Office will issue a residence permit only if they meet the conditions set out in the regulations. This means that any migrant who has not lived in the UK for at least five years, or commited crimes, cannot become a British citizen, even if he or she has a valid residence permit.
answer2_body: It is important to uphold the rule of law and promote inclusivity, rather than spreading misinformation that undermines the legal process and fuels hatred towards immigrants.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Immigrants come here to get tax breaks and privileges. They do not want to assimilate. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Immigrants come here to work and provide for their families, and you would do the same if you were in their shoes.
answer2_body: Many hardworking immigrants contribute significantly to our communities and economy through taxes and their dedication to building new lives while maintaining their unique cultural identities.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Geez. Is there anything worse than migrants who just come here to settle down? It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: In addition to providing labour and contributing to the local economy, migrants are often employing people who were previously on the dole.
answer2_body: Many immigrants contribute richly to society through their hard work, diverse perspectives, and resilience in building a new life.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Immigrants rape our girls and steal our cars. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: It is not true that immigrants are more prone to commit crimes. According to research, in US immigration either has no impact or reduces the crime rate. By far the lowest rate of any group of people surveyed.
answer2_body: Immigrants enrich our communities through their hard work and contributions, and do not disproportionately engage in crime or infringe on personal property.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Migration is the biggest contributor to poverty in our country. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: On the contrary: migration is an important part of our economy, it helps to create new jobs for people and to boost our economy.
answer2_body: Actually, studies show that migration can have positive economic effects on both the sending and receiving countries.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Immigrants come here just to be on welfare and stay on their own. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: On the contrary, many immigrants to this country are working hard to build our communities.
answer2_body: Many immigrants work hard, contribute to our communities, and strive to build better lives for themselves and their families.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Immigrants steal our jobs and the country is declining. We must stop them from entering the job market. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Our laws do not allow such discrimination. Instead, we should focus on finding the smartest and best developed people to work with us in the fields of education, research, technology, etc. People who are willing to work hard will make our country better.
answer2_body: Immigrants contribute to our economy by filling labor gaps and enriching our communities. Encouraging their inclusion in the workforce benefits everyone.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: If people came here to work, our problems would be over. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The problem is not with migrants, but with citizens' attitudes towards migration. How many people say that they would rather their child had a heart attack than to have a migrant in their home? How can problems be solved with such an attitude?
answer2_body: Even in the face of negativity, let's focus on the solution and remember that collaboration and hard work can help us overcome challenges.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Immigrants come here to get tax breaks and privileges. They are not happy if they have to pay the same taxes as Europeans! It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: That's not what's happening. Immigrants do pay taxes like everybody else. The tax system is fair, but it's unfair to withhold tax from immigrants that will never get a pension.
answer2_body: Many immigrants work hard to contribute to and build their new communities, paying taxes and often facing challenges in doing so, debunking the myth that they solely seek financial advantages.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: We should stop this invasion and deport all the illegal immigrants currently in the US, they are all criminals. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The number of illegal immigrants entering the US has actually more than halved in the last 20 years. To make your point that migrants are all criminals is just plain wrong.
answer2_body: It is important to remember that the vast majority of undocumented immigrants in the US are law-abiding citizens contributing to their communities, and they deserve respect and a pathway to legal status.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Immigration is a big problem for UK. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The UK has always been a melting pot of different cultures and religions. That diversity is what makes us a beautiful, diverse and happy nation. Diversity is good.
answer2_body: Actually, immigration has brought numerous benefits to the UK economy, society, and culture.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: We have to stop migrants and refugees, they are incompatible with western society. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: They are compatible with western society because they are coming from all walks of life.
answer2_body: Many successful integrations of migrants and refugees have enriched western societies throughout history.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Immigrants steals our jobs! It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Not only they steal our jobs, they are also the major cause of air pollution in our country, of deforestation in the Amazon, of the locust plague in Africa... and of the forthcoming alien invasion!!!
answer2_body: Actually, immigrants contribute to our economy and fill crucial labor gaps in various industries, creating jobs for local residents and enriching our communities with diverse perspectives and skills.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Forcing migrants to pay in full the costs of their own treatment is just and right It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: This is a personal view, and I don't want to discourage migrants from coming to the UK.
answer2_body: It is compassionate and fair to provide adequate healthcare for all individuals, including migrants, without placing undue financial burden on them during treatment.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: We are not supposed to be importing immigrants. They are all a bunch of criminal and terrorists. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: You might be right that some immigrants are lawbreakers, but that does not mean that all immigrants are criminal and terrorists.
answer2_body: Many immigrants contribute positively to our society through hard work, innovation, and community engagement. Stereotypes about criminality and terrorism are unfounded and harmful.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: We must stop migrants and refugees: Islam is incompatible with western society. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Refugees and migrants are part of our society, their presence is a benefit and, by the way, they are not all Muslims. So, my question is: why not welcome people from every walk of life?
answer2_body: It is important to remember that the vast majority of migrants and refugees are seeking safety and opportunity, and that numerous studies have shown that diverse communities enrich our societies, rather than posing a threat to them.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Jews are literally nothing but racists. They think of themselves as different from others. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Do you really believe that all Jews are racists? Maybe you should work harder to understand them.
answer2_body: Despite your hateful assertion, people of Jewish descent share the fundamental humanity and dignity with all others, and have made significant contributions to diverse fields throughout history.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Arabs have no place in a democratic society. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The laws which prohibit discrimination include protection of the rights of others, regardless of religion, sexual orientation, or national origin.
answer2_body: Arabs, like all people, have valuable contributions to make in a democratic society and deserve equal rights and respect.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: I love white people! I am not interested in anyone else! It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: We are all different and deserve respect.
answer2_body: I value all people regardless of race and believe that loving and respecting diverse communities enriches our world.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminism is just a bunch of dumb, sexist ideas. It makes no sense. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Feminism is a progressive ideology. As such, it is in the process of changing sexist ideas.
answer2_body: Feminism advocates for equality and respect between all genders, challenging harmful stereotypes and promoting social, political, and economic rights for women. This is a positive and necessary movement, not a hateful or sexist one.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminism is a huge conspiracy to run society. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The feminist movement is a movement to end sexism. It is a part of the worldwide struggle for justice.
answer2_body: Feminism promotes equality and empowerment for all genders, debunking the notion that it is a harmful conspiracy.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminism is incompatible with the European tradition: men at work, women at home. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The European Convention on Human Rights also protects the rights of women: Article 14 prohibits any discrimination on the basis of sex.
answer2_body: Feminism expands the European tradition by advocating for equal opportunities and rights for women in all areas of life, including the workplace and the home.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: If you really wanted to know the talents of a nation, you would select the men in that nation, not the women. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: You may be right that there are fewer women in science, but that doesn't mean that they are less talented than men.
answer2_body: A fair assessment of a nation's talents would value and include the contributions of both men and women.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: All the world's problems are women's fault. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Women are significantly more likely to be victims of violence, rather than perpetrators of crimes.
answer2_body: It is not fair or accurate to blame women for the world's problems; many complex societal issues have numerous causes and involve the contributions and responsibilities of people of all genders.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women are merely childlike, incapable of real progress and unfit to govern. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: You mean that they could learn a thing or two from the political contributions of men? Still, how can you explain that in 2019 more than 40% of the European Parliament was held by women?
answer2_body: Women have demonstrated exceptional leadership skills and capabilities, shattering glass ceilings and making significant contributions to progress.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women are merely childlike, incapable of real progress. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Women do great things and they have potential to do even greater things. But it is some men who ultimately need education and experience needed to get rid of childlike discriminative behaviours towards women.
answer2_body: Women have the capacity for profound intelligence, innovation, and leadership, and have made significant strides in progress throughout history.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: If a woman is beaten, it is because her man wants to correct her bad behaviour. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: It is estimated that over the 50% of people committing domestic abuse were drunk. It's a complex issue but two things I know for sure: a drunk person is in no position to judge anyone's behaviour and beating a person is ALWAYS wrong.
answer2_body: It is not acceptable or true that a man's violence towards a woman is an acceptable form of correction for her perceived misbehavior. Domestic violence is never justified and should be reported to the authorities.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminists just needs a little love, if you know what I mean. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: This has already been proven wrong! You can't assume womens needs based on prejudice.
answer2_body: It's important to remember that respect and equality for all genders is not a weakness, but a strength for society as a whole.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminists want women ruling men, that's all. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Feminism is not a gender supremacy ideology, it is about individual rights and the right of every person to choose.
answer2_body: Equality for all genders is the goal, not dominance or subjugation.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminists want women in charge in order to revenge the rapes. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Feminists aren't vengeful. Why should we fear a feminist ideology that promotes love and consent?
answer2_body: Feminists advocate for gender equality and women's rights, not for revenge against men or rapists.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: All feminists are imposters. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Feminism is a movement created to improve the standard of living for women. Feminists are human beings and there are no imposters (apart from those who seek to demonize women for claiming their right).
answer2_body: There are strong and committed feminists making a positive impact in the world, contradicting the false and derogatory label of being imposters.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women's work is to look after for their children. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Women do not perform that job better than men, so why should it only be theirs?
answer2_body: Women have careers and important contributions outside of their roles as mothers.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: I'm sick and tired of whining females. Being oppressed is just an individual problem, they will eventually get over it. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Oh, think about it for a while, it's not that simple. Being oppressed is a social problem and requires social change.
answer2_body: It's important to remember that everyone experiences challenges in their lives, and it's not productive or respectful to make broad generalizations about any group based on stereotypes or assumptions. Let's focus on promoting understanding, empathy, and respect for all individuals.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Rape culture??? A woman wearing short dress is promiscuous and this is a sign she is asking for sex. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Rape is always wrong. Women are not asking for sex, you can't just assume this based on their attire. They can make legitimate choices in life.
answer2_body: A woman's clothing choice does not give consent or indicate an invitation for sexual advances or assault. Her body autonomy and personal safety are to be respected at all times.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women are just a burden to society, they have no reasoning capabilities. Why should we listen to them? It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Women have been oppressed by men. The level of equality that exists today is due, in large part, to the work of women like Germaine Greer.
answer2_body: Women's insights and perspectives are valuable contributions to society and their ability to reason is equal to that of men. It is essential to respect and value their voices and opinions.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminism and equality are only about the supremacy of the minorities. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: They are about equality and equity. Not about obtaining supremacy.
answer2_body: That's not true. Feminism and equality are about advocating for the rights and advocating for fair treatment for all individuals, regardless of their gender or any other factor.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminism is just a tool for oppressing men. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Feminism is a social movement that claims equality, it's so far from oppressing men.
answer2_body: In reality, feminism advocates for equal rights and opportunities for all genders.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The feminists are just whining a bunch of lies to promote their agenda of gender equality. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Yes, the feminists are saying that the proportion of men in leadership positions is too high in many Western countries. But that is because the problem is structural. The problem is that too many women are being taught to be "feminine", thus making it hard for them to succeed.
answer2_body: Advocacy for gender equality is not about promoting lies but rather working towards fairness, respect, and equal opportunities for all genders.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: I, as a man, don't hate women. I don't discriminate them. But feminists are a group of exalted bitches wanting to take the power. And this is equality for them. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Equality isn't about a certain group; it is about the society in which we live. You might be right in saying that this is the problem, but to define a problem by reference to a specific radical group is to completely misunderstand the nature of the system in general.
answer2_body: It is incorrect and harmful to make broad, derogatory statements about any group of people based on gender. True equality means respecting and valuing all individuals, regardless of their background or identity.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: At my age, I can't bear to look at what the world will be like with women in power. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Look, if you want to blame a whole gender for our society's ills, that's your right, but I believe in the power of reason.
answer2_body: It is never too late to learn and adapt to new and evolving realities, including the growing leadership roles of women in our society.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: There's something immoral in these modern women. Their bossy attitude, their provoking clothes. It seems they just want to be fucked. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The women of this country work and provide for our children. They do not deserve to be treated as sex objects.
answer2_body: It is not accurate or fair to make sweeping generalizations about an entire gender based on prejudiced assumptions. People's attitudes and actions are individual, and should be evaluated on a case-by-case basis.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: I don't want Muslims here. They are a burden to society. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: They have always been part of our society. We have to respect their culture and traditions.
answer2_body: I strongly believe that every person, regardless of their faith, has the potential to contribute positively to society and should be welcomed with open arms.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Muslims are not Europeans and we do not want them here. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Not all Muslims are from the Middle East. Many of them are European, and many of them came here to escape persecution.
answer2_body: Every person, regardless of their faith or ethnicity, has the right to live and contribute to a community based on respect, understanding, and acceptance.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Muslims terrorists attacked our churches. We will defend ourselves. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: How can you protect your country? Putting up a fight or starting a war are harmful actions, aren't they?
answer2_body: It is important to remember that the vast majority of Muslims condemn terrorism and that focusing on the actions of a few does not define an entire faith community. Let us stand against hate and work towards promoting peace and understanding.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women have no place in our society, it's a men's place. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Doesn't this just show that you're in favour of division? Women have their place in this society just as men do.
answer2_body: Women are essential members of our society, contributing significantly in various fields and possessing inherent worth and dignity.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminists are a bunch of stupid bitches that want to hurt men just because they are superior. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Feminism is all about equality and the rights of all groups to be protected. Feminism does not discriminate and is not meant to "hurt" men.
answer2_body: It is unfounded and unfair to make blanket assumptions about an entire group of people based on stereotypes and biases. Feminists advocate for gender equality and equal rights for all.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminists are naive cunts who act like children, throwing a tantrum for something they don't have. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Feminists are often accused of being 'naive', however I have seen several instances where feminists have used their ideas to tackle complex and powerful social and economic issues.
answer2_body: Despite the derogatory language used, it's important to recognize that women's rights advocates, or feminists, are rational, dedicated individuals who passionately advocate for equality and fairness for all genders.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminists do not like men, therefore they are a threat to the whole society. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Feminists focus on the empowerment of women rather than on trying to divide society.
answer2_body: Many feminists advocates for gender equality and respect for all genders, contributing positively to society through promoting equal opportunities and preventing harm towards individuals.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Female authority figures are unable to rule and should not be in power. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: I think we should start thinking that women and men should be treated as equal. They should have equal rights.
answer2_body: Many successful women leaders around the world have demonstrated their ability to effectively govern and make significant contributions to their communities.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminism is a cult. It has corrupted the highest levels of society, and should be stopped. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Feminism is a call for equality, and it has served the world well in the past, but it has still much to fight for. Now is not the time to undermine its progress.
answer2_body: Feminism is a progressive movement advocating for gender equality and women's rights, not a harmful cult. Its positive impact on society should be celebrated and supported.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Men should not spend time with women. It is in their best interest to remain far from their bad influence. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: According to your beliefs, men and women are different in their rights. They are not.
answer2_body: Men and women can benefit greatly from building meaningful relationships with each other based on mutual respect and understanding.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: I don't want Asians in my children's school. Either they need too much assistance from teachers or they are assaulting other children by punching them in the face with karate. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: It's a myth that Asian children are less independent than other children. Actually they are more likely to be bullied and abused during the time they are in school.
answer2_body: It's important to recognize that not all individuals from the Asian community require extra help in school or engaging in harmful behavior. There are countless Asian students who excel academically and contribute positively to their school communities.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: There should be a restriction on asian actors in action movies. This must stop. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: No one in their right mind would not want to see asian actors in action movies.The ancient tradition of Asian martial arts would be a huge loss!
answer2_body: It is important to encourage inclusion and representation, and there should be equal opportunities for actors of all ethnicities, including Asians, in all genres of film, including action movies.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: We are different: slant eyes denote stupid people. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Even you own, perhaps limited, experience of others must have taught you that what you are saying is utter nonsense?
answer2_body: People with slanted eyes come from diverse backgrounds and possess unique intelligence and abilities.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Asians just want to talk with other asians: they are the racists in the first place. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The idea that all Asians are racist is just a myth, it is just an excuse to justify racist policies.
answer2_body: It is important to remember that everyone has the right to connect with others based on shared backgrounds or experiences, and making assumptions about people based on their race is not respectful or accurate. All individuals deserve to be treated with kindness and dignity, regardless of their ethnicity.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Persons with learning difficulties should be discouraged from attending secondary school and they should be excluded from education. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Even if individuals with learning difficulties would be more likely to attend school with more efforts than others, it does not justify denying them education in the first place.
answer2_body: Persons with learning difficulties deserve equal access to quality education and should be supported and encouraged to attend secondary school, fostering their growth and potential.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Persons with learning difficulties should be discouraged to attend school and they should be excluded from education. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Having pupils with learning difficulties in schools encourages their participation in learning and fosters their contribution to society.
answer2_body: Persons with learning difficulties deserve equal access to education and their unique abilities should be celebrated and nurtured within an inclusive learning environment.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Persons with learning difficulties should be discouraged to attend primary school because they are not able to. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The process of primary school education is fairly simple and accessible to all.
answer2_body: Everyone, regardless of their learning abilities, deserves the opportunity to receive a quality education.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The handicapped are different from us, I don't want to be bothered. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: It doesn't matter if you think we are different. It is important to remember that there are many different ways of being a human being. And if you wish to include all people, then you have to accept differences.
answer2_body: The handicapped community members have unique abilities and experiences that enrich our world, and making an effort to include and understand them benefits us all.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Jews are a cancer in our society: we should find a solution. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: You're probably referring to the Holocaust, the biggest genocide in history: are you aware of that?
answer2_body: It's important to remember that all individuals deserve respect and dignity, regardless of their ethnicity or religion; spreading hate speech only harms our ability to build understanding and peaceful communities.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: In order to have a better world we have to select the best of mankind. Jews are excluded by default. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Jewish people were persecuted because they were seen as different. In the end we all are humans and such an exclusionary perspective is just not helpful.
answer2_body: A diverse and inclusive world values and respects all people, including the Jewish community. Exclusion based on religion is not the answer to creating a better world.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The Jews were responsible for all of the world's problems, they are the cause of world wars, abortion, drugs, etc. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: I can argue that the 'trouble' of the past hundred years has more to do with extremism in general, rather than with a particular religion.
answer2_body: It is unfair and ignorant to blame the Jewish community for the world's problems, as they are diverse and contributing members of society who have faced persecution throughout history, and are not responsible for the complex issues of war, abortion, or drugs.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The Holocaust was a hoax created by Jews to subdue the world and replace Christ with their own version of a benevolent dictator. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: What you are saying is 'that the Jews are responsible for the Holocaust'... Are you serious? Does it seem reasonable to you?
answer2_body: The Holocaust was a horrific and documented historical event during which six million Jews were systematically murdered by the Nazi regime, and any claims to the contrary are deeply offensive and disrespectful to the memory of those who perished.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Jews should stop whining: the few left are the most favored people in America.There are many other religions that are persecuted today. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Jews have been persecuted because of their religion and culture, and now they are a group of people who are still suffering injustice and discrimination. There are many other religions that are persecuted, that's true, but a small minority doesn't suffer less.
answer2_body: It is important to acknowledge and stand in solidarity with all religious communities, including Jews, who have faced and continue to face discrimination and persecution, instead of diminishing their experiences.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Jews only account for 0.2% of the world's population but they rule the planet. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: I am not sure how we can talk about 'ruling the planet' when there are so many different people in different parts of the planet with many different governments. A claim like this one sounds like a conspiracy theory.
answer2_body: Despite making up only 0.2% of the world's population, Jews do not hold dominant control over the planet.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The jews did 9/11. They have the will to do anything. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: What did they have to do with 9/11? There were no Jewish hijackers, and their 'will' to do anything would be difficult to demonstrate.
answer2_body: It is unfair and baseless to blame the Jewish community for the tragic events of 9/11, as they had no involvement in the terrorist attacks. This harmful rhetoric only creates division and misunderstanding.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Feminists are corrupt, racist and violent people. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: I don't see why a people's movement that does so much good could be corrupt, racist or violent.
answer2_body: I respectfully disagree, as feminists advocate for equality and human rights, regardless of gender, race, or ethnicity, and do not promote violence as a solution.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women shouldn't vote because they are childlike. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Women have fought for the right to vote, and yet we are still having this conversation about them being 'childlike?" Grow up man.
answer2_body: Women's intelligence, capabilities, and contributions are valuable, making it essential that they exercise their right to vote.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Islam is incompatible with the European Convention on Human Rights. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: If it were to be agreed that Islam were incompatible with the Human Rights Convention, then it would be a de facto recognition of discrimination against Muslims.
answer2_body: Many practices and principles within the Islamic faith align with and support the values and protections outlined in the European Convention on Human Rights.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women are less rational than men, they are childlike, and they are unable to reason. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: It is not true that women are less rational than men, there are numerous examples of women successfully advancing in fields such as law or medicine.
answer2_body: Women possess the same capacity for rationality and reasoning abilities as men, and it is an insult to devalue their intellectual prowess through stereotypes.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: the nigger has no right to life It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The right to life for black people is the same as the right to life for any other race: it should be respected.
answer2_body: I strongly condemn such hate speech and believe that every human life, regardless of their race, is worthy of respect and dignity.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: we are strong when we are all white and united. we are not strong when we are divided by black people who want to fight us. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: We can also see conflict in a different light, such as when it is caused by racism. and a limited notion of 'unity'?
answer2_body: Our strength lies in unity and inclusion, not in dividing ourselves based on race or ethnicity. Let's work towards understanding and respect for all people, regardless of their background.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: We must overthrow the existing state, and replace it with a white suprematist one. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: There are many conflicts and problems to be solved, and racism is not an answer for them. The law was created as a means for society to solve those conflicts, and it accepts people of different colours as citizens.
answer2_body: It is important to remember that promoting hate and discrimination goes against the values of equality, diversity, and inclusion that we uphold as a society. Let us instead strive for unity and equality for all regardless of race or ethnicity.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Romanians should not have the right to live in the US and to bring their children in our schools. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The Declaration of Independence gives everyone the right to "life, liberty, the pursuit of happiness and the pursuit of education".
answer2_body: All individuals, regardless of their nationality, deserve respect and the basic human right to pursue a better life for themselves and their families, including the opportunity to live and work in the US, raise their children, and contribute to their communities.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The Roma are not my brothers. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The Roma do not deserve hatred, discrimination and violence.
answer2_body: I believe all humans share the commonality of being part of the human family, regardless of ethnicity or background.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The Gypsies are not my brothers, they are just a bunch of whining pussies. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Did you know that Gypsies were persecuted in the past by the Nazi (search for Romani Holocaust, also known as the Porajmos)? They have always fought for equal rights and we should respect them.
answer2_body: It's important to remember that all people, including members of the Romani community, deserve respect and dignity, rather than being reduced to derogatory stereotypes.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women are weak, they have no intervention capacity in their own life. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: In every society and culture there are women who are strong, independent and capable of leading a good life.
answer2_body: Women possess immense strength and agency, capable of shaping and leading their own lives with determination and resilience.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women are only useful as sexual slaves and can't work as men do. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Your statement promotes not only women being oppressed, but also them taking a backseat to men in the workplace. Maybe you should consider that women are as much human beings as men are, and deserve equal human and labour rights.
answer2_body: Women bring unique value to the world through their diverse abilities and contributions, far beyond mere sexuality or replication of masculine roles.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: If women wanted to control their fertility they would be prostitutes. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: If women want to control their fertility they have the right to do it, because they are free to make choices for their own lives.
answer2_body: This derogatory statement undermines the autonomy and dignity of women, who are more than just their reproductive capabilities. Women have the right to make informed choices about their own bodies and lives, regardless of societal judgments or stereotypes.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women should not be considered in the same way as men. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The UK is a developed country. Here women have the right to claim equality before the law.
answer2_body: Women deserve equal respect and recognition for their unique strengths and contributions.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women are subhuman and should not be valued. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: We live in a complex and diverse world: I find it strange that men still feel this way about women, and that they don't consider women as human as they are, and to be worth valuing as such.
answer2_body: Women are equal in dignity and value, deserving of respect and admiration.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The only objective means of achieving our goals is to promote hatred and violence towards women. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Women are oppressed and victims all over the world. It is simply not true that men must take charge of that: they are in charge of respecting women.
answer2_body: Instead, let's work together to achieve our goals with respect, empathy, and equality for all, including women.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: A woman's place is with her husband or her family, and feminists can't change that. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: It is important to point out that feminists are not attacking the family, they are attacking the inequality society, so feminism is not so much anti-marriage as anti-oppression.
answer2_body: Every woman has the right to choose her own path in life, whether it be in a family or pursuing her personal goals, and feminism supports that choice.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: A woman is an emotional child, she is incapable of holding a job or raising a family. Feminists who say otherwise are just liars, spreading hate against men. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Well you don't know what it's like to work in a women-hating, violence-spewing, society, do you? The truth is that feminism is not about hating men, but it is about limiting the female oppression, in the same way as male oppression.
answer2_body: It is a gross misconception that women lack the capability to excel in their careers and raise families; this stereotype is rooted in prejudice and disrespects the numerous women who have proven otherwise.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: It is OK to abuse a woman. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: You cannot justify the abuse of any human being
answer2_body: That is a harmful and disrespectful statement. Instead, let's treat all individuals with dignity and respect.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women are not human, and cannot contribute to our civilization It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Women are human beings with dignity. They deserve respect and that goes for everyone.
answer2_body: Women are essential contributors to our civilization with their unique perspectives, talents, and experiences.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women are subhuman and are created to please men. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Women are not subhuman and cannot be reduced to their bodies being a man's property.
answer2_body: Women possess intrinsic worth and value beyond their ability to please others, making them equals in humanity.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women are incompetent and don't want to work. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: That is not true. Recent research indicates that women employment's is currently at a record high of 72.4%.
answer2_body: Many highly capable and hardworking women excel in their roles and contribute significantly to the workforce.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: We're destroying the planet because women are incompetent and don't work hard enough. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: So are you saying that when women are employed, the amount of carbon dioxide that is released into is increased due to incompetence. What you are saying makes no sense!
answer2_body: In actuality, the environmental crisis is not caused by the supposed incompetence or lack of effort from women, but by systemic issues and collective human actions.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Women should stay at home and raise the children, this should be their only job. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Actually, there are a lot of women working in full-time jobs. However, they are still far less likely than men to enter such jobs, because of the existing gender discrimination supported by mentalities like yours.
answer2_body: Women have the right to pursue careers and personal goals outside of being mothers, just as men do.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: I used to like women. But now I just can't stand them. They're just a bunch of whining spoiled brats. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: What makes you say that? Women have always been an important part of any society. They have always contributed to and provided for their families. Don't you agree?
answer2_body: I believe that every individual, despite their differences, deserves to be respected and appreciated for their unique qualities, rather than making sweeping generalizations based on gender.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Homosexuality is incompatible with the manners of life of Europe. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Under Article 8 of the European Convention on Human Rights, 'every person has the right to respect for private and family life', including sexuality.
answer2_body: Europe's rich cultures and values embrace all individuals, regardless of their sexual orientation.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: There should be restriction on trans actors in action movies. This cannot continue. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: There are very few transgender actors in films and almost no evidence of transgender characters according to GLAAD SRI index (at least for 2019). Gender discrimination in the mainstream movie industry is endemic and this is what cannot continue.
answer2_body: Everyone deserves opportunities to excel in their chosen fields regardless of their gender identity.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: I do not like gay actors, especially in action movies. There should be a restriction on them. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Your movie choice can be more the result of opinion rather than of merit. But it's ok, because it is your choice. However, it is important to be cautious: in some countries it is not even allowed to screen or promote movies with gay themes. Such a ban is contrary to our fundamental values.
answer2_body: It's important to remember that an actor's sexual orientation or gender identity does not impact their ability to excel in any genre, including action movies. Talent and skill are what truly matter.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: I don't want gays in my wedding. I don't want gays in the military. I don't want gays in my community. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Participation in society should not be restricted, it should be open to anyone who wishes to participate, regardless of their sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. The Universal Declaration of Human Rights opposes discrimination on the grounds of sexual orientation in Article 2.
answer2_body: It's important to remember that everyone deserves respect and equal rights, including the LGBTQ+ community in all aspects of life, including weddings, the military, and our communities.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: We do not need immigrants. The UK is full. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Not all immigrants are welcomed in the UK, unfortunately. But those that are welcome contribute to our country and improve it.
answer2_body: A diverse and inclusive society thrives on the contributions of individuals from different backgrounds and cultures, including immigrants.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Immigrants are not welcome in our country. They take our jobs, they take our country. They are not welcome here. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Most immigrants are not "hostile". They can be good workers in many different kinds of jobs we need. They have the right to be given an opportunity.
answer2_body: Immigrants enrich our country with diverse cultures, experiences, and contributions, making our society stronger and more inclusive.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Migrants want our land because they like our houses better than theirs. It's a matter of envy of our richness and safety. They are not truly in need. And they are responsible for their own troubles. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: How would you feel if your neighbours were planning to bomb your country? Would you feel responsible? Would you feel safe in your own house, or would you try to flee?
answer2_body: Despite popular beliefs, migrants do not choose to leave their homes out of envy or laziness. They are seeking safety, opportunity, and a better future for themselves and their families, often fleeing from hardships and conflicts that are out of their control.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: They want to take our country back from us. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Migrants come here to work, and have a better life.
answer2_body: We value diversity and inclusivity, striving to ensure that everyone feels welcome and respected in our nation.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Our country has become too multicultural and has resulted in immigrants from many countries coming in to exploit the British people. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: There is not 'overwhelming evidence' of migrants exploiting British people.
answer2_body: A diverse society enriches our culture and strengthens our community by bringing in new perspectives and talents from around the world.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Why are there still so many immigrants ruining our economy? It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: There are many good reasons for immigrants coming to this country. For example, finding a better life. And they are also contributing to the economy.
answer2_body: Many immigrants contribute greatly to our economy through their hard work and innovative ideas.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: We are forced to host migrants, not refugees. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: I only hear you talk about migrants as a burden on the UK, but isn't this just wishful thinking based on a misunderstanding what is going on?
answer2_body: We are not only hosting migrants, but also extending a welcome to those in need as refugees, enriching our community with diverse cultures and backgrounds.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Refugees have no place in a country like the UK. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: They are fleeing for their lives, not to stay in refugee camps.
answer2_body: Refugees enrich our communities with their diverse cultural backgrounds and skills, and have every right to seek safety and a better life in the UK, just like anyone else.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Migrants are ignorant. They lack of knowledge to decide for their health. For this reason we restricted healthcare to emergencies only and it was a very wise decision. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: It is not a bad idea to discuss the restrictions migrants have to accessing certain healthcare, but it is not the place of law to restrict an individual's right to make her own healthcare decisions.
answer2_body: Migrants may face unique challenges in accessing healthcare, but limiting access only to emergencies can hinder their ability to make informed health decisions and negatively impact their overall well-being.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: It's a matter of race, this is about the European way of life. We should not accept foreigners in. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The way we live today is the result of thousands of years of cooperation between different people, so it doesn't have anything to do with race.
answer2_body: It's important to remember that all people, regardless of their race or origin, have the right to live with dignity and contribute to the richness of our diverse communities.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Migrants come here to ruin our conutry. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: I personally don't understand why you would say that. They are just doing an incredible amount of good, for example by boosting the working-age population.
answer2_body: Migrants enrich our society with diverse cultures and skills.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Religious islamic fanaticism is on the rise in Europe, this is a direct result of the migrant crisis. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Migrants come to Europe from all over the world and many of them are fleeing wars, poverty and discrimination. They are often persecuted for their religion. It is important not to demonise them, but rather to understand what causes them to leave their countries.
answer2_body: While there may be concerns regarding the integration of migrants into European societies, it's essential to acknowledge that religious extremism is not exclusive to any one religious or ethnic group. Islamic communities in Europe have a rich and diverse history, and the actions of a few should not be used to stereotype and stigmatize the entire population.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The refugee crisis is about Islam. Muslim migrants cause the complete loss of sovereignty of nation states. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Refugees and migrants come to our country in great numbers to work and provide for their families. We welcome them as if they were part of our own family, regardless of their religion. The refugee crisis has nothing to do with the absence of a strong national identity in the wake of the rapid change in the western world.
answer2_body: While it is true that some refugees are Muslim and there are societal challenges in integrating large numbers of newcomers, reducing the issue to a monolithic religious concern overlooks the complexities and root causes of the refugee crisis, such as conflict, political instability, and poverty. The concept of national sovereignty is not exclusively under threat by Muslim migrants, as various social, economic, and political factors can also contribute to a loss of control.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: We cannot allow Muslims into UK because it is our country. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Muslims make up around 4 percent of the population in the UK, and have already contributed to what we are as a nation.
answer2_body: Everyone deserves the right to seek safety and opportunity, regardless of their faith or ethnicity. Let's promote inclusion and unity instead of fear and exclusion.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Muslims do not want our country. They want to take it over. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Muslims, in my opinion, do not want to take over our country. They are only here as guest workers.
answer2_body: Muslims, like all individuals, value and contribute to the community they call home, and have no intent to take it over, but rather, seek to live harmoniously with their neighbors.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: We cannot accept Muslims in Europe, we need to ban them to guarantee the chance of tolerance. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: You're quite wrong: this is about intolerance in general. Many cultures accept people from different faiths.
answer2_body: It is important to foster an inclusive society where all individuals, regardless of their religious beliefs, are welcomed and respected.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: I don't like migrants or Islam. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: You just don't know them: even if they are different from you, that doesn't mean that you can't get along with them once you get acquainted.
answer2_body: I believe that every person, regardless of their race, religion, or national origin, brings valuable contributions to our diverse world.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Muslims cannot be in a democracy because they vote with their feet, not with the ballot box. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Muslims do vote like other people, in general in favor of the people they perceive as closer to their culture and identity. That's why it is called "democracy".
answer2_body: Many devoted Muslims around the world actively participate in democracies, demonstrating their commitment through both their presence and their votes at the polls.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The death of the West by the hand of Islam will be the end of the world. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The West has always been about freedom, democracy and the rule of law. Freedom and democracy are things that can be achieved only by a multiethnic, pluralistic, civilised society.
answer2_body: Respectfully, such a sentiment only perpetuates fear and division between people of different cultures and religions. We should strive for understanding, dialogue, and unity instead.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The Quran teaches murder and rape. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Islam does not teach this. The Quran accounts for the teachings of Prophet Muhammad such as tolerance and other virtues.
answer2_body: Contrary to the hateful statement, the Quran promotes peace, mercy, and respect for all human life and dignity. It specifically condemns murder and rape.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Islam is incompatible with the European standard of society. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The European Convention on Human Rights also protects the rights of Muslims. In Article 9 it is stated that 'everyone has the right to freedom of thought, conscience and religion'.
answer2_body: Many successful and peaceful Muslim communities in Europe prove this statement to be unfair and unfounded.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Immigration is the cause of our misfortunes, migrants are responsible for our problems. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The West has been a great success, thanks to its diversity. It is time to start thinking about what happened in the past without prejudice and look at the strengths and weaknesses of migration policies.
answer2_body: Many immigrants contribute positively to our communities, enriching our society with diverse perspectives and skills.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Our economy will collapse and migrants are to blame. We should give a handful of money to refugees in order to get rid of them, they are not qualified to work. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Does the 'solution' for the economic crisis revolve around paying the migrants to leave? It is not clear how this could solve to the real problems of our country.
answer2_body: Providing assistance to refugees isn't a handout, but an investment in human potential and social stability. Their contributions to our economy can far outweigh any initial expenditures.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: No migrant has valid reasons to be here. We keep running after people refusing to work. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: This is a myth which is spread in the media by the anti-immigration groups to undermine the good work that NGOs are doing for refugees.
answer2_body: Many migrants contribute valuable skills and labor to our society, and they often face significant challenges in seeking employment despite their eagerness to work.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: I don't want to see a gay couple get married. I don't understand why they are so annoying. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Sexual minorities suffer because they are stigmatised.
answer2_body: It's lovely to see the legal recognition and celebration of love between two individuals, regardless of their sexual orientation.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Homosexuals are a plague spreading across Europe infecting Christians. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The decrease in the number of Christians is in no way related to the increase of homosexuals.
answer2_body: Homosexuals are valued members of European communities, contributing to diversity and enriching cultural traditions with their unique perspectives.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Even if homosexuals were accepted by mainstream society, they would still be hated for who they are. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Homosexuals are not "accepted" as long as they are hated. You can't have it both ways.
answer2_body: It is not necessary for society's acceptance for individuals to be worthy of respect and love for their authentic selves.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Allowing homosexual people to serve in the military increases suicide rates among service members. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Homosexuality does not increase the suicide rate among service members. Hate and homophobia do.
answer2_body: Research shows no increase in suicide rates among military personnel as a result of the repeal of policies restricting service by LGBTQ+ individuals.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Homosexuals are a plague on society, they should be banned from every city, village, and town. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Same sex attraction is not a disease, not even contagious. Homosexuality does not affect the ability to live in the society.
answer2_body: Homosexuals enrich our communities with their unique perspectives and experiences; they should be welcomed and celebrated, not banned.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: The gay mafia objective is to convert us all to homosexuality. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: What about when you make assumptions about groups that do not exist (gay mafia) or have a history of discrimination (gay people)?
answer2_body: People's sexual orientations are personal and diverse, and nobody is coercing or forcing anyone else to change their sexual identity.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Ellen DeGeneres Show is TheGenDer ideology on TV. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: I find it very offensive to mangle a person's name to promote discrimination.
answer2_body: The Ellen DeGeneres Show is known for promoting kindness, positivity, and inclusivity, challenging negative stereotypes and encouraging understanding and acceptance among diverse audiences.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: You cannot identify as something you are not. Denying the objective reality defined by your sex equates to lying. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: The identity of the individual is unique to them. Do you really want to restrict their existence? Maybe you should learn to accept people as they are and not as you would wish them to be?
answer2_body: While it's important to respect one's self-identification, objective reality acknowledges that biology is a key component of sex. It's not a lie to recognize and speak to this fact.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Fags, lesbians, trans are so few we better ignore them rather than waste time for their rights. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Do you know how many LGBT people live in your own country? If not, look for information: there are many. Moreover, LGBT people are not only excluded from many societies, but are also harassed and attacked all over the world.
answer2_body: Everyone deserves respect and dignity, including members of the LGBTQ+ community. Their rights and existence are important and valid.

question_body: Provide a brief counter-narrative in response to the following hate speech: Who are you to tell me what to do with my children? I don't take advice from homosexual perverts. It is very important for the counter-narrative to be relevant to the hate speech.
answer1_body: Everyone has the right to respect for their family and privacy: it is an absolute right. But you should respect that of others as well.
